articles.title: Data center builders thought farmers would willingly sell land, learn otherwise
articles.description: Even in a fragile farm economy, million-dollar offers can't sway dedicated farmers.
articles.content: It seems that tech giants eyeing rural zones for data center development have underestimated how attached American farmers have grown to their lands in the decades they've been nurturing them. Across the country, several farmers have firmly rejected eye-popping offers—sometimes in the tens of millions. These offers dwarf the value of their properties, but farmers have refused to put a price on the lands that they love most. In a report on Monday, The Guardian highlighted a handful of cases natio
articles.author: Ashley Belanger

articles.title: Peptides are everywhere. Here’s what you need to know.
articles.description: MIT Technology Review Explains: Let our writers untangle the complex, messy world of technology to help you understand what’s coming next. You can read more from the series here. Want to lose weight? Get shredded? Stay mentally sharp? A wellness influencer might tell you to take peptides, the latest
articles.content: MIT Technology Review Explains: Let our writers untangle the complex, messy world of technology to help you understand what’s coming next. You can read more from the series here . Want to lose weight? Get shredded? Stay mentally sharp? A wellness influencer might tell you to take peptides, the latest cure-all in the alternative medicine arsenal. People inject them. They snort them. They combine them into concoctions with superhero names, like the Wolverine stack. Matt Kaeberlein, a longevity res
articles.author: Cassandra Willyard

articles.title: Apple will start making Mac minis in the US
articles.description: Starting later this year, Apple will start manufacturing Mac minis meant for sale in the US within the country. The company took The Wall Street Journal on a tour of its Houston facility, where Foxconn is also building servers for Apple Intelligence, and was shown an empty warehouse. Apple says it w
articles.content: Starting later this year, Apple will start manufacturing Mac minis meant for sale in the US within the country. The company took The Wall Street Journal on a tour of its Houston facility, where Foxconn is also building servers for Apple Intelligence, and was shown an empty warehouse. Apple says it will turn the space into a 220,000 square feet plant where it will produce the compact desktop computers. The decision to produce Mac minis for local sales within the US is part of the company’s effort
articles.author: Mariella Moon

articles.title: The US military will reportedly use Elon Musk's Grok AI in its classified systems
articles.description: The US Department of Defense has reportedly reached a deal to use Elon Musk's Grok in its classified systems, according to Axios . That follows news that the Pentagon is currently in a dispute with another AI company, Anthropic, over limits on its technology for things like mass surveillance. La
articles.content: The US Department of Defense has reportedly reached a deal to use Elon Musk's Grok in its classified systems, according to Axios . That follows news that the Pentagon is currently in a dispute with another AI company, Anthropic, over limits on its technology for things like mass surveillance. Last year, the White ordered Grok, along with ChatGPT, Gemini and Anthropic's Claude to be approved for government use. Up until now, though, only Anthropic's model has been allowed for the mili
articles.author: Steve Dent

articles.title: The best webcams for 2026
articles.description: Whether you’re on back-to-back video meetings, live streaming or just trying to look presentable on a family call, your webcam matters more than most might expect. The cameras built into laptops are fine in a pinch, but they rarely deliver consistent image quality, especially in less-than-ideal ligh
articles.content: Whether you’re on back-to-back video meetings, live streaming or just trying to look presentable on a family call, your webcam matters more than most might expect. The cameras built into laptops are fine in a pinch, but they rarely deliver consistent image quality, especially in less-than-ideal lighting. A dedicated webcam can noticeably improve sharpness, color accuracy and overall reliability. There’s no single “best” webcam for everyone, though. Some models are built around higher resolutions
articles.author: Valentina Palladino

articles.title: We’re putting more stuff into space than ever. Here’s what’s up there.
articles.description: Earth’s a medium-size rock with some water on top, enveloped by gases that keep everything that lives here alive. Just at the edge of that envelope begins a thin but dense layer of human-built, high-tech stuff. People started putting gear up there in 1957, and now it’s a real habit. Telescopes look
articles.content: Earth’s a medium-size rock with some water on top, enveloped by gases that keep everything that lives here alive. Just at the edge of that envelope begins a thin but dense layer of human-built, high-tech stuff. People started putting gear up there in 1957, and now it’s a real habit. Telescopes look up and out at the wild universe. Humans live in an orbiting metal bubble. In the last five years, the number of active satellites in space has increased from barely 3,000 to about 14,000—and climbing.
articles.author: Jonathan O'Callaghan

articles.title: AI Slop vs Constrained UI: Why Most Generative Interfaces Fail
articles.description: TL;DR AI can generate structured interface layouts and assemble component hierarchies from natural language prompts. When generation is unconstrained, the output diverges from design systems, lacks determinism, and requires downstream refactoring before deployment. Production-grade generative UI req
articles.content: TL;DR AI can generate structured interface layouts and assemble component hierarchies from natural language prompts. When generation is unconstrained, the output diverges from design systems, lacks determinism, and requires downstream refactoring before deployment. Production-grade generative UI requires predefined component registries, validated schemas, and explicit architectural constraints, which is the model implemented by Puck and its constrained generation layer, Puck AI . Introduction AI
articles.author: Astrodevil

articles.title: Billions of dollars later and still nobody knows what an Xbox is
articles.description: The last few years of Xbox have been expensive. Under Phil Spencer's leadership, Microsoft has spent billions of dollars in an attempt to build an ambitious future for gaming that looks a lot like Netflix. And while its subscription service Game Pass started out as a good deal for gamers (although n
articles.content: The last few years of Xbox have been expensive. Under Phil Spencer's leadership, Microsoft has spent billions of dollars in an attempt to build an ambitious future for gaming that looks a lot like Netflix. And while its subscription service Game Pass started out as a good deal for gamers ( although now not so much ), that spending spree has led to catastrophic layoffs, studio closures, and confused and inconsistent messaging about what Xbox actually stands for. And with Spencer set to retire as
articles.author: Andrew Webster

articles.description: "The point is to get missions out the door as fast as possible. Two to three years is too slow."
articles.content: DALLAS—The Space Force officer tasked with overseeing more than $24 billion in research and development spending says the Pentagon is more interested in supporting startups building new space sensors and payloads than adding yet another rocket company to its portfolio. The statement, made at a space finance conference in Dallas last week, was one of several points Maj. Gen. Stephen Purdy wanted to get across to a room full of investors and commercial space executives. The other points on Purdy's
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: Why conservationists are making rhinos radioactive
articles.description: Every year, poachers shoot hundreds of rhinos, fishing crews haul millions of sharks out of protected seas, and smugglers carry countless animals and plants across borders. This illegal activity is incredibly hard to disrupt, since it’s backed by sophisticated criminal networks and the perpetrators
articles.content: Every year, poachers shoot hundreds of rhinos, fishing crews haul millions of sharks out of protected seas, and smugglers carry countless animals and plants across borders. This illegal activity is incredibly hard to disrupt, since it’s backed by sophisticated criminal networks and the perpetrators know that their chances of being caught are slim. With an annual value of $20 billion, according to Interpol, it’s the world’s fourth-most-lucrative criminal enterprise after trafficking in drugs, wea
articles.author: Matthew Ponsford

articles.title: Amazon Games is winding down King of Meat
articles.description: King of Meat 's reign is ending. The game will end service on April 9, less than a year after its October 2025 debut. The Amazon Games-published title will be playable until that date, but will then be taken entirely offline. "Despite the creativity and innovation Glowmade brought to King of Mea
articles.content: King of Meat 's reign is ending. The game will end service on April 9, less than a year after its October 2025 debut. The Amazon Games-published title will be playable until that date, but will then be taken entirely offline. "Despite the creativity and innovation Glowmade brought to King of Meat, the game has unfortunately not found the audience we hoped for," the announcement read. Developer Glowmade had high hopes for King of Meat, its debut game, but it fell starkly short of expectations
articles.author: Sarah Fielding

articles.title: The TypeScript Performance Lie: How V8 Actually Runs Your Code
articles.description: The most common question asked during interviews with JS developers is: "What is TypeScript and why is it needed?" The classic answer: "It's an extension of JS that adds static typing and speeds up development." And that's absolutely true. When the code base grows so large that it can no longer be m
articles.content: The most common question asked during interviews with JS developers is: "What is TypeScript and why is it needed?" The classic answer: "It's an extension of JS that adds static typing and speeds up development." And that's absolutely true. When the code base grows so large that it can no longer be managed by a single team, strict contracts save the project from drowning in dozens of unpredictable undefined and runtime errors. Engineers who come from statically typed languages (such as C++, Java,
articles.author: Maxim Krendel

What I actually wanted: type a question, get a grounded answer that pulls live prices, recent earnings, and current news in one shot. Turns out you can wire this up in
articles.content: I got tired of jumping between Yahoo Finance, a broker dashboard, and a Google News tab every time I wanted a quick read on a stock. What I actually wanted: type a question, get a grounded answer that pulls live prices, recent earnings, and current news in one shot. Turns out you can wire this up in an afternoon with Vercel AI SDK and Valyu's financeSearch + webSearch tools. Here's how. What we're building A Node.js CLI agent you run like this: npx tsx agent.ts "What's happening with NVDA? Give

But the future of the $380 billion AI startup comes down to just three words: "any lawful use." The
articles.content: Anthropic's weekslong battle with the Department of Defense has played out over social media posts, admonishing public statements, and direct quotes from unnamed Pentagon officials to the news media. But the future of the $380 billion AI startup comes down to just three words: "any lawful use." The new terms, which OpenAI and xAI have reportedly already agreed to, would give the US military carte blanche to use services for mass surveillance and lethal autonomous weapons, AI that has full power

articles.content: Last week's surprise departure of Phil Spencer from Microsoft led to the promotion of Asha Sharma, who comes to head Microsoft's gaming division after two years as president of the company's CoreAI Product group . Despite that recent history, Sharma says in a new interview that she has "no tolerance for bad AI" in game development. Speaking with Variety , Sharma noted that "AI has long been part of gaming and will continue to be," before adding that "great stories are created by humans." The int
articles.author: Kyle Orland

Antitrust Division chief Gail Slater announced her departure suddenly, via a post on her personal X account. But to those
articles.content: In mid-February, the Department of Justice lost its head antitrust enforcer - just weeks before it was scheduled to argue one of the year's biggest anti-monopoly cases in court. Antitrust Division chief Gail Slater announced her departure suddenly, via a post on her personal X account. But to those who follow the agency closely, it was far from surprising. For months, leaks about the division described tensions between Slater and her team with DOJ leadership, and President Donald Trump's penchan
articles.author: Lauren Feiner

articles.title: Panasonic, the former plasma king, will no longer make its own TVs
articles.description: Panasonic was one of the last Japanese companies still manufacturing TVs.
articles.content: Panasonic, once revered for its plasma TVs, is giving up on making its own TV sets. Today, it announced that Chinese company Skyworth will take over manufacturing, marketing, and selling Panasonic-branded TVs. Skyworth is a Shenzhen-headquartered TV brand. The company claims to be “a top three global provider of the Android TV platform.” In July, research firm Omdia reported that Skyworth was one of the top-five TV brands by sales revenue in Q1 2025; however, Skyworth hasn’t been able to maintai
articles.author: Scharon Harding
